channel.title: Warnings after Update
channel.description:
Hello!
I tried to update whonix after I installed it with qubes os. But there are some errors showing up and I couldn't find a solution:
It says that the file size for three files are not what the server reported: - tb-updater_3%3a3.7.9-1_all.deb - tor_0.2.8.9.1-d80.jessie+1_amd64.deb - whonixcheck_3%3a4.6.4-1_all.deb
I read that this error regarding the tor file should be no problem, but what about the two other files?
My second issue is when I run "whonixcheck" a warning is displayed: "Check Kernal Messages Test Result: Remarkable kernel message found using dmesg. Clocksource: timekeeping watchdog: Making clocksource 'tsc' as unstable because the skew is too large
I also found some information about that issue but I didn't understand it (lack of technical knowledge).
I would really appreciate an explanation in absolute simple words so that I can understand it ;-)
Thanks for any help!

item.title: Warnings after Update
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
alex.alex:

It says that the file size for three files are not what the server reported:

If you put
"whonix file size for three files are not what the server reported"
into search engines you should fine existing discussions on that.

Size of file dists_jessie_main_binary-amd64_Packages.gz is not what the server reported

alex.alex:

Clocksource: timekeeping watchdog: Making clocksource ‘tsc’ as unstable because the skew is too large

Same for searching for:

qubes Clocksource: timekeeping watchdog: Making clocksource ‘tsc’ as unstable because the skew is too large

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/qubes-users/vXAvgLREDRk

Read full topic

item.title: Warnings after Update
item.dc:creator: alex.alex
item.description:
Hello!

I tried to update whonix after I installed it with qubes os. But there are some errors showing up and I couldn’t find a solution:

It says that the file size for three files are not what the server reported:

  • tb-updater_3%3a3.7.9-1_all.deb
  • tor_0.2.8.9.1-d80.jessie+1_amd64.deb
  • whonixcheck_3%3a4.6.4-1_all.deb

I read that this error regarding the tor file should be no problem, but what about the two other files?

My second issue is when I run “whonixcheck” a warning is displayed: "Check Kernal Messages Test Result: Remarkable kernel message found using dmesg.
Clocksource: timekeeping watchdog: Making clocksource ‘tsc’ as unstable because the skew is too large

I also found some information about that issue but I didn’t understand it (lack of technical knowledge).

I would really appreciate an explanation in absolute simple words so that I can understand it

Thanks for any help!

Read full topic
